alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 3:54PM PST until December 29 at 1:41AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon and Washington... Nehalem River near Foss affecting Clatsop and Tillamook Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Tualatin River near Dilley affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tualatin River near Dilley. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 17.5 feet, several minor roads begin to flood and may be closed. Widespread lowland agricultural flooding occurs at this and higher stages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM PST Tuesday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Don`t drive through flooded areas. Find another route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/portland. The next statement will be issued by 4 AM PST Wednesday.
